author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request met all of the guidelines for auto-merging and is scheduled to be merged when the mandatory waiting period (3 days) has elapsed.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have read the package naming guidelines: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

Why are you renaming the package? Doesn't that only cause trouble for users?

[noblock]

I explained here:
https://github.com/timholy/SnoopCompile.jl/pull/140#issuecomment-702272669

In short: 
- SnoopCompileBot was not a package that other packages would depend on. It is a package to be used on its own. Thus, changing the name does not have any disadvantages.
- I had an idea for creating a bot for PackageCompiler. Now, that the repository is no longer a sub-directory of SnoopCompile, I can extend its purpose.


I did not just change the name without providing deprecation messages, so those who use the old version will be informed about this change: 
https://github.com/timholy/SnoopCompile.jl/pull/140
@fredrikekre Is there anything else? The registration of this package has become a burden for me. I want to continue developing, but I can't.
@fredrikekre @DilumAluthge I am still waiting for this
You need to edit all of your comments to include the text [noblock]. Otherwise AutoMerge will not merge it.
